dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1170 IH: Access to Future Cures Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Arrington (for himself, Mr. Panetta, and Mr. Hern) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to clarify that expenses for blood storage qualify as expenses for medical care.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Access to Future Cures Act.

section.header: Expenses for blood storage qualify as expenses for medical care

subsection.text: Section 213(d)(1)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting (including expenses for storage of blood or biomaterial derived from blood) after function of the body.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to expenses paid or incurred after the date of the enactment of this Act.
